Issues.Title: Restore ToolboxSnapDragDropEventArgs implementation
Issues.Body:
Resolves #6919

 `ToolboxSnapDragDropEventArgs` is necessary to facilitate the "general purpose designer" experience as shown in [#6919](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/6919#issuecomment-1121000602).

## Proposed changes

- Restore `ToolboxSnapDragDropEventArgs` implementation. The type was ported in #122, but had no actual use until #4860, when `ToolboxItemSnapLineBehavior` was ported for .NET 6 Preview5. It looks like a genuine oversight, given the size of #4860.


<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- Without the implemented `ToolboxSnapDragDropEventArgs` it is not possible to provide the "general designer" experience, such as drag-and-drop a control or component from a toolbox.


## Regression? 

- Yes, from .NET Framework

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4403806/168703595-68e5c235-fdad-4b8e-afbc-87debe96b057.png)


### After

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4403806/168703297-4b7d345c-5e7e-402d-bb2f-d86d7f4e2766.png)



## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manually using the provided sample in #6919: [DesignerSample.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/8651342/DesignerSample.zip)
- I have also reviewed another instances of NIE throughout the codebase, and there doesn't appear to be more issues of this kind. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4403806/168704668-8d92362f-8cbe-46f6-a98b-94be7b2efe8b.png)
    * `ComponentDesigner` is largely implemented, and `InitializeExistingComponent` is expected to be implemented by developers of a "general purpose designer". 
    * We don't expect to provide implementations for `ComponentDocumentDesigner` unless there is a strong business justification. 
    * The same applies to `AxImporter`.
    * [`BindingContext.CollectionChanged` event](https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/api/system.windows.forms.bindingcontext.collectionchanged#remarks) is obsoleted in .NET Framework


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7184)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Restore ToolboxSnapDragDropEventArgs implementation" (#7184)

Issues.Title: Fix TreeView overflow exception
Issues.Body:
Fixing an overflow exception in `TreeView` control in 32 bit process due to incorrect cast from `uint -> IntPtr`.

Fixes #7098 


## Proposed changes

- Cast return value (`nint`) of `GetMessagePos()` in the `TreeView `control to `int` before casting it to `IntPtr`


<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- Customer should be able to use `TreeView `control in a 32-bit process.

## Regression? 

- Regressed from .NET 3.1

## Risk

- Low. Similar change is in .NET 7.0 since Preview 1

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7183)

Issues.Title: Failed to open designer
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Version 17.3.0 Preview 1.0

### .NET version

net7.0

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

_No response_

### Issue description

Seeing
```
[18:37:53.343110] fail: System.InvalidOperationException: Can't resolve types until ITypeIdentityResolutionService has started processing enqueued assemblies.
                           at Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Protocol.Types.AssemblySearchingTypeIdentityResolutionService.TryGetType(TypeIdentity typeIdentity, Boolean ignoreCase, Type& type)
                           at Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Protocol.Types.AssemblySearchingTypeIdentityResolutionService.ResolveNamedType(TypeIdentity typeIdentity, TypeIdentityResolutionOptions options)
                           at Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Protocol.Types.TypeIdentityResolutionService.ResolveType(TypeIdentity typeIdentity, TypeIdentityResolutionOptions options)
                           at Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.Types.BaseTypeResolutionService.GetType(String name, Boolean throwOnError, Boolean ignoreCase)

                        For information on how to troubleshoot the designer refer to the guide at https://aka.ms/winforms/designer/troubleshooting.
[18:37:53.450100] fail: REQUEST FAILURES: Sessions/EndLoad
                        Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.DesignToolsServerException: 'Site' must not be null in order to access a required service.

                        For information on how to troubleshoot the designer refer to the guide at https://aka.ms/winforms/designer/troubleshooting.

```

### Steps to reproduce

Take sample app from https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/6952 and open in the designer.

### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Failed to open designer" (#7182)

Issues.Title: Second DataGridView with CalendarColumn does not display data in the cells
Issues.Body:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/Second-DataGridView-with-CalendarColumn-/10043008)._

---
[severity:It's more difficult to complete my work]
Using the CalendarColumn from the "How to: Host Controls in Windows Forms DataGridView Cells" documentation example, I have modified the program to create a DataTable to use as a source for the datagridview.
I use AutogenerateColumns=true and the ColumnAdded event to replace the textboxcolumn with the CalendarColumn. 
This works correctly for this first DataGridView.
I then duplicated the code to create a second DataGridView and second DataTable.
This second grid also uses AutoGenerateColumns and the ColumnAdded event to replace the textboxcolumn with the CalendarColumn. 
However, this second grid does not display values in the columns even though the column contains the CalendarColumn as can be show by editting a grid cell.
BUT, if I reverse the creation of the grids, by creating the second grid first, and the first grid second, then the second grid contains data but the first grid does not. To me this verifies that the code is correct. (ie. reverse lines 226 and 227, Build_grid_1() and Build_Grid_2() )
What is wrong, am I missing something?
PS. I am developing an application that needs to use a custom column in two grids displayed on the same form.
This is my test case. 
I will upload my test program.

---
### Original Comments

#### glynn.stuber on 5/16/2022, 02:23 PM: 

(private comment, text removed)
#### Feedback Bot on 5/16/2022, 04:50 PM: 

(private comment, text removed)

---
### Original Solutions
(no solutions)

Issues.Body:

Also rename `inst` to `instance` to conform to code style

Issues.Title: Use LibraryImport in some Interop User32
Issues.Body:
Now that https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/60595 is closed, perhaps we could start using LibraryImport instead of DllImport.

## Proposed changes

- Use LibraryImport in some Interop User32.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7172)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Use LibraryImport in some Interop User32" (#7172)

Issues.Title: Reverse resetting the Anchorinfo when size chnages.
Issues.Body:
This is a regression caused by #6778 that was helping optimize anchor info calculation.
However, in certain scenarios, we access `AnchorInfo` by assuming it was initialized at the time of handle creation and resetting it to null with `size change` is causing null reference exception in those scenarios.  Given regression was introduced in the current preview, taking this revert while we are investigating on how to get anchor layout working for higher DPI machines.

Fixes #7159 and #7090


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7170)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Reverse resetting the Anchorinfo when size chnages." (#7170)

Issues.Title: [dotnet-sdk-7.0.100-preview.5.22257.3] WinForm Apps thrown Object reference not set to an instance of an object when setting values to Label.Text
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

7.0.100-preview.5.22257.3

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

**Verify Scenarios:**
1). Windows10 RS5 x64+dotnet-sdk-7.0.100-preview.5.22257.3: Fail
2). Windows10 RS5 x64+dotnet-sdk-7.0.100-preview.5.22258.1: Fail
3). Windows10 RS5 x64+dotnet-sdk-7.0.100-preview.4.22252.9: Pass

### Issue description

**Application Name**:  pomodoroflavors, HeroesPowerPlant, GameofLife
**OS:** Windows 10 RS5
**CPU:** X64
**.NET Build Number**: dotnet-sdk-7.0.100-preview.5.22257.3

When testing the above 3rd party apps against dotnet-sdk-7.0.100-preview.5.22257.3, it fails with "Object reference not set to an instance of an object" when setting values to Label.Text.

**Findings:**

1. If we set Text from Properties window, then change the Text value from button click event, it works fine.
2. If original text string is number and changed string is characters, or original text string is characters and changed string is number,  and the length should be same before and after change, the issue will appear.

**StackTrace from Application:**
See the end of this message for details on invoking
just-in-time (JIT) debugging instead of this dialog box.
```
************** Exception Text **************
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at System.Windows.Forms.Layout.DefaultLayout.GetAnchorDestination(IArrangedElement element, Rectangle displayRect, Boolean measureOnly)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Layout.DefaultLayout.LayoutAnchoredControls(IArrangedElement container)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Layout.DefaultLayout.TryCalculatePreferredSize(IArrangedElement container, Boolean measureOnly, Size& preferredSize)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Layout.DefaultLayout.LayoutCore(IArrangedElement container, LayoutEventArgs args)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnLayout(LayoutEventArgs levent)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Form.OnLayout(LayoutEventArgs levent)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.PerformLayout(LayoutEventArgs args)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.PerformLayout()
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.ResumeLayout(Boolean performLayout)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Label.OnTextChanged(EventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.set_Text(String value)
   at PomodoroDesktop.Pomodoro.UpdateCountdownOnScreen() in F:\Onboardapps\pomodoroflavors-main\pomodoroflavors-main\PomodoroDesktop\ResultProject\PomodoroDesktop\Pomodoro.cs:line 66
   at PomodoroDesktop.Pomodoro.StartCountdownTimer(Int32 minutesToCountdown) in F:\Onboardapps\pomodoroflavors-main\pomodoroflavors-main\PomodoroDesktop\ResultProject\PomodoroDesktop\Pomodoro.cs:line 42
   at PomodoroDesktop.Pomodoro.btnPomodoro_Click(Object sender, EventArgs e) in F:\Onboardapps\pomodoroflavors-main\pomodoroflavors-main\PomodoroDesktop\ResultProject\PomodoroDesktop\Pomodoro.cs:line 25
   at System.Windows.Forms.Button.OnMouseUp(MouseEventArgs mevent)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WmMouseUp(Message& m, MouseButtons button, Int32 clicks)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ButtonBase.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlNativeWindow.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.NativeWindow.Callback(IntPtr hWnd, WM msg, IntPtr wparam, IntPtr lparam)

```

### Steps to reproduce

**Minimal Repro steps:**
**The machine only has 7.0.100-preview.5.22257.3 installed. The Demo project is attached.
[WinFormsDemo.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/8660697/WinFormsDemo.zip)
 **

1. Create a default WinForm App with Visual Studio and target the app to .NET 7.0
2. Drag a Label and a Button control to the form.
3. Double click the button and add below code in Form1.cs file: 
```
        public Form1()
        {
            InitializeComponent();
            label1.Text = "aaa";
        }

        private void button1_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
        {
            label1.Text = "123";
        }
```

4. Press F5 to launch the app.
5. Click button.

**Expected Result:** 
The Label's Text content will become "123".

**Actual Result:**
It will throw Object reference not set to an instance exception. The stack trace shows:
```
   at System.Windows.Forms.Layout.DefaultLayout.GetAnchorDestination(IArrangedElement element, Rectangle displayRect, Boolean measureOnly)
```

@dotnet-actwx-bot @dotnet/compat
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[dotnet-sdk-7.0.100-preview.5.22257.3] WinForm Apps thrown Object reference not set to an instance of an object when setting values to Label.Text" (#7159)

Issues.Title: Optimizing virtual mode checking when user uses keyboard to change checkbox state
Issues.Body:
Fixes #6096

## Proposed changes

Optimizing virtual mode checking when user uses keyboard to change checkbox state.
Changed ListView.cs at line 6702:
if (CheckBoxes) 
to 
if (CheckBoxes && !VirtualMode)
Existing unit test:
ListView_WmReflectNotify_LVN_KEYDOWN_SpaceKey_HasCheckBoxes_WithoutGroups_CheckedExpected

## Customer Impact
Optimized algorithm enhances performance and is easy to support. 

## Regression? 
No

## Risk
Minimal

## Test methodology
Unit tests

## Test environment(s)
Microsoft Windows [Version 120.2212.4170.0]
.NET Core SDK: 7.0.100-preview.3.22179.4


<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->
